products.title: Micro Swiss CM2™ Nozzle for FlowTech™ Hotend
products.body_html:
Micro Swiss CM2™ Nozzle is an ideal nozzle for all applications. Core of the nozzle is made of high-temperature Copper Chromium Zirconium and plated with an Electroless Nickel Plating. This special alloy retains its strength at much higher temperatures compared to a regular copper alloy. The tip of the nozzle is made of M2 Hardened High Speed Steel and coated with a special nonstick nano coating.

Micro Swiss CM2™ Nozzle Features:

  • Copper Chromium Zirconium body

    • Plated with an Electroless Nickel Plating

  • M2 Hardened High Speed Steel insert
    • Plated with a Electroless Nickel Plating
    • Coated with nonstick nano WS2 coating.
    • Coefficient of friction: 0.035
    • Heat-treated hardness:  68 HRC

  • Orifice size available: .4mm, .6mm, .8mm, 1.0mm

  • Limited lifetime warranty against wear

Made in USA by Micro Swiss

Supported Hotends:

  • FlowTech™ Hotend for Creality K1 / K1 Max / K1C (M3101)
  • FlowTech™ Hotend for Creality CR-10 SE (M3102)
  • FlowTech™ Hotend for Creality Ender 3 V3 KE (M3103)
  • FlowTech™ Hotend for Creality Ender 3 V3 SE (M3105)
  • FlowTech™ Hotend for Creality Ender 3 V3 (M3106)
  • FlowTech™ Hotend for Elegoo Neptune 4 / 4 Pro (M3107)
  • FlowTech™ Hotend for Elegoo Neptune 4 Plus/ 4 Max (M3108)
  • FlowTech™ Hotend for Sovol SV08 (M3110)
  • FlowTech™ Hotend for Bambu Lab X1 and P1 Series (M3119)
  • FlowTech™ Hotend for Creality K2 Plus (M3111)

products.title: Bigtreetech EBB 36/42 MAX Can Bus for Klipper Hotend Tool Head Expansion Device
products.body_html:
The BIGTREETECH EBB42 CAN and EBB36 CAN are nozzle adapter boards made for 42 and 36 extruder motors. They connect using CAN BUS, making wiring easier to the toolhead. 

Features:

  • User can select the thermistor's pull-up resistors values through jumper wire, so as to support PT1000 (2.2K pull-up resistors), which makes it convenient for DIY.
  • Reserved I2C interface allows for filament broke and clogged detection, and supports other DIY functions.
  • Added anti-flyback diodes on the heating rod and fans' ports effectively protect the MOS tube from being burned due to reverse voltage.
  • Anti-reverse connection protection on the power interface prevents users from burning the motherboard when mistakenly connecting the reverse power line during DIY.
  • Onboard MAX31865 supports selecting 2-wire or 4-wire of PT100/ PT1000.
  • Supports communication via CAN or USB. The terminal resistor 120R of CAN can be selected through the jumper cap, and it reserves CAN expansion interfaces.

What is Included: 

Depending on Selection

  • 1x Toolhead PCB EBB36 or EBB42 or U2C
  • 1x Toolhead Connector Pin/Connector Pack

Not Included:

  • Wiring Loom (Source Here: https://store.dremc.com.au/products/can-bus-cable-by-3do)

Documentation: 

Note 1: Please ensure you have compatible board that support CANBUS or you need U2C connected to your raspberry pi.

Note 2: Wiring is not included. We do recommenced using FEP/PTFE wiring if using drag chains. Kit include one set of each tool head connectors and pins, excluding type c cable. Ensure your power line(24/12v) have enough AWG (20-22AWG), while dataline 24-26awg is suitable or source a 4 core 22 awg wire. Ensure you have fuse on power line when possible. 

Note 3: Always verify STM chip version when flashing firmware.

For more information about BTT EBB CAN , you can check below resources:

Guide: https://support.dremc.com.au/support/solutions/articles/51000313005-ebb36-ebb42-documentation

Github: https://github.com/bigtreetech/EBB

Youtube Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_FELCN8CbWA

Product History

  • Order after November 15th 2025, board shipping may be V1.2.1
    • Version 1.2.1 adds ESD protection to the motor interface to prevent static electricity from causing driver errors.

products.title: Revo™ Brass Nozzle
products.body_html:
Swap your 3D printer’s nozzles in less than 60 seconds without tools or hot tightening – just use your fingers! If you can unscrew a tube of toothpaste, you can use a Revo Nozzle. Just screw one in to any Revo cold side and you’re ready to 3D print.

  • Compatible with Revo cold sides, including Revo Six, Revo Micro, and Revo Hemera
  • No need to hot tighten – each Revo Nozzle is a factory-assembled nozzle and heatbreak in one
  • Works with a Revo HeaterCore for faster heat-ups and greater efficiency than most HotEnds on the market
  • Compatible with popular FDM 3D printers, such as Creality, Ender, Prusa, Anet, Biqu, Monoprice, and many more

Nozzle Size Available:

  • Brass 0.25mm
  • Brass 0.4mm
  • Brass 0.6mm
  • Brass 0.8mm

Key features:

  • Input diameter: 1.75mm
  • Maximum temperature: 300°C

Documentation:

  • Revo Nozzle Documentation
  • Revo Nozzle Datasheet
  • Revo Nozzle Starter Slicer Settings

Please note:

- Revo™ Nozzles are not compatible with V6-style heaterblocks

- You may need to adjust your Z offset when changing nozzles.

products.title: Cookiecad Elixir PLA Filament 1.75mm 1kg
products.body_html:
Cookiecad Elixir Filament comes in a selection of solid tones and gradient hues, delivering a glossy surface with intensified brilliance that produces a shimmering appearance.

Pale Blue Elixir - it is the same pale blue you love but with added shimmer, shine, and an iridescent blue tint. It is a strong and glossy filament and prints with a beautiful shine.
Mint Green Elixir - it is the same mint green you know and love but with added shimmer, shine, and an iridescent blue tint. It is a strong and glossy filament and prints with a beautiful shine.
Pixie Dust- it is a hot pink with added shimmer, shine, and an iridescent blue tint. It is a strong and glossy filament and prints with a beautiful shine.
Lavender Elixir - it is the same lavender you know and love but with added shimmer, shine, and an iridescent tint.
Solar Flare - it is a sunny yellow with added shimmer, shine, and an iridescent tint.
Sunrise Elixir - it has three colors on one spool plus shimmer! The color will change slowly over time, so small objects will only contain one color. You can print multiple items at a time, large items, or increase infill to get more of the color change into a single print. The colors will fade from pink, to orange, to yellow and back to pink.

Unicorn Elixir - it has three colors on one spool plus shimmer! The color will change slowly over time, so small objects will only contain one color. You can print multiple items at a time, large items, or increase infill to get more of the color change into a single print. The colors will fade from pink, to purple, to blue and back to pink. Every color in the transition is beautiful.

Nightshade Elixir - it is a beautiful bright and berry purple PLA with a blue shimmer. 

Empty Plastic Spool ~177g

Printing Settings

For best results, dry filament using a filament drier before use. Keep in an airtight container for medium/long term storage with silica desiccant. [If you hear popping or inconsistent extrusion while purging filament, suggest drying before printing for best results] Filament Drying Guide

Nozzle Temperature 190°C - 235°C
Build Plate Temperature 50°C - 60°C*
Build Surface Material Works well with most common build surfaces.
Build Surface Treatment Typically none required. Some surfaces such as glass work best with PVA glue stick or Magigoo .
Cooling Fan ON
Printing Speed 20 mm/s - 40 mm/s
Retraction The ideal retraction settings vary from printer to printer. If you find the retraction settings are causing gaps in your part, the following settings may help.
Direct Drive: Retraction distance of 0.5 - 1mm with retraction speed of 20mm/s
Bowden: Retraction distance of 2 - 3mm with retraction speed of 20 - 40mm/s
Drying Recommendation ~50°c for 4-6hrs (Only dry if filament is wet, over drying/repeat drying can damage filament) (Filament Dryer Guide)
Storage Keeping filament in an airtight container with new/dried desiccant.

Based on 0.4 mm nozzle. Printing conditions may vary with different printers and nozzle diameters.

products.title: Revo™ ObXidian / ObXidian 500 Nozzle (HF / SF Edition)
products.body_html:
The ObXidian nozzle offers wear resistance far surpassing any other E3D nozzle, exceeding the hardness of Nozzle X and all other standard hardened steel nozzles by several orders of magnitude. This exceptional durability comes from combining a tool steel insert with the innovative E3DLC™ coating. This unique coating also provides built-in non-stick features, significantly reducing plastic buildup around the nozzle during use.

Note: For filled filaments such as CF/GF, we do recommended larger than 0.5mm nozzle. 

What is Included:

  • 1x E3D Revo ObXidian Nozzle (HF or ST depending on your selection) (ObXidian 500 or ObXidian depending on your selection) 

HF Edition Features:

Higher Flow.

Revo ObXidian™ High Flow increases your setup's volumetric flow rate, enabling you to print abrasive materials faster!

How does this work?

Revo™ High Flow maintains the exact same form factor as standard Revo HotEnds; this means there is no need to adjust your pre-existing mount and fan duct setups! These High Flow nozzles use a unique custom internal geometry to increase the surface area for improved thermal transfer to the filament.

SF Edition Features:

Experiment freely.  With nozzle swapping this easy, you’re free to experiment with nozzle sizes you might not have used before. Set your 3D printer up for ultra-fine or ultra-thick extrusion widths in no time at all. Print large objects in less time or tiny objects with high resolution.  

Frustration-free.  Each Revo Nozzle is a preassembled nozzle and HeatBreak in one unit, so there’s no hazardous hot tightening and no chance of incorrect assembly. Say goodbye to frustrating HotEnd leaks and enjoy reliable 3D printing!  

Rapid identification.  Identify nozzle sizes at a glance, thanks to a colour-coded silicone sock. Plus, each Revo Nozzle has its size engraved into it with easy-to-read numbers, so there are no confusing identification markers to learn!  

An expanding range.  We’re ready to make RapidChange Nozzles in any size. Currently, we have brass nozzles in 0.15mm, 0.25mm, 0.4mm, 0.6mm and 0.8mm, with many more compatible nozzles to follow later. Wear-resistant and high-flow variants are already on our roadmap and will follow over time. 

Please note:

  • Revo™ Nozzles are not compatible with V6-style heaterblocks
  • You may need to adjust your Z offset when changing nozzles.
  • ObXidian™ coated nozzles are exceptionally wear resistant compared to other products on the market and significantly outperform other hardened nozzles. Improvements in ‘exotic’ engineering filaments mean that some new materials which include aggressive fillers, including but not limited to Polymaker’s PolyMide range (PA612-CF, PA6-CF, PA6-GF and PA12-CF), can cause significant wear on even ObXidian nozzles. E3D is actively developing even more specialist solutions for these materials. In the meantime please be aware that even the rainbows and unicorns in your ObXidian nozzle are not everlasting under extreme material conditions.
  • Some filled materials contain particles that are close to, if not larger than, some of the smaller industry standard nozzle sizes, including up to 0.4mm. Attempting to print such materials through these nozzle sizes significantly increases the risk a jam. Please check your filament manufacturer’s datasheet for recommended minimum nozzle orifice diameter to ensure that the nozzle/hotend you choose is suitable for your use case.

products.title: Bigtreetech TMC2209 V1.3 Stepper Motor Driver
products.body_html:
TMC 2209 V1.3 is an ultra-silent motor driver IC for two-phase stepper motors. Its continuous drive current is 2A and peak current is 2.8A. This is design for BTT Mainboard that support step stick with URT support (it may be compatible with other boards, but you need confirm step stick slot pinout) 

Features: 

Stepper Motor Driver based on a Trinamic TMC 2209

  • Hardware compatible with StepStick and Pololu A4988
  • Step/Dir interface with microstep interpolation (up to 256 microsteps)
  • StealthChop2 - for quiet operation and smooth motion
  • SpreadCycle - highly dynamic motor control chopper
  • CoolStep - current control for energy savings
  • StallGuard4 - sensorless motor load detection

What is difference between TMC 2209 V1.2 vs TMC 2209 V1.3

  • Added Protection diode

What is actual difference between these with TMC2208?

  • TMC2209 Silent Step Sticks have output drivers with a lower power dissipation and a higher current is possible.
  • TMC2209 Silent Step Sticks feature cool Step and stallGuard4(optimised for stealthChop).
  • TMC2209 SilentStepSticks can be switched between stealthChop and spreadCycle mode via a configuration pin(SPREAD).
  • TMC2209 Silent Step Sticks drivers have the v2 pinout (Vref and DIAGO swapped).

What is Included:

  • BIGTREETECH TMC2209 V1.3 Stepper Motor Driver (Quantity, depending on your selection) 

[ Item Include Heat Sinks ]

Note: If you have quantity pack is not unavailable but we have other quantity in inventory, contact support for invoice or we can update quantity on listing for you. 

Documentation:

https://github.com/bigtreetech/BIGTREETECH-Stepper-Motor-Driver/tree/master/TMC2209

 https://bttwiki.com/TMC2209.html

products.body_html:
Ideal replacement for old belts on 3D printers. The LL-2GT-6 RF belt is more stiff, withstands higher stretching loads and has a greater tensile strength than the cheaper alternatives due to the inclusion of glass-fibre reinforcement and dust proof coating. 

  • 6mm Width with 2mm pitch
  • Glass-Fibre reinforced rubber belt
  • RF has dust proof coating on belt to improve longevity. 
  • A uniquely designed tooth profile distributes the load over the entire belt, allowing the belt to withstand greater loads
Do you require custom length or require Creality Copper custom length for your printer? Please send your Purchase Order request via our contact us.

These are genuine Gates products, distributor certificate available on request from our distributor. 

Printer Compatibility:

For many 3D Core X/Y setups, including models like the Voron 350 or Creality K1 Max, the required belt length per axis is generally less than 2 meters. If you’re unsure, please measure your current belt or contact us for expert assistance.

1 Nozzle Pack

  • Available sizes : 0.40, 0.60, 0.80, 1.0, 1.4 and 1.8mm;

Check the White Paper:

"Increasing Melt Capacity With 3 Nozzle Features"

Main Bondtech CHT® Advantages

  • Higher melt capacity by increasing the surface area of the heating walls
  • Affordable price
  • Machined with ultra-precision
  • Brass nozzle with Nickel coated surface
  • Follows nozzle standards:
    • RepRap (M6×1×7.5×12.5)
    • MK8 (M6×1×5×13)
  • May be used with 1.75 or 2.85mm hotends.
  • Optimized for 1.75mm filament;
  • Compatible with 2.85mm filament.
  • Requires 8mm wrench

Advantages of the Bondtech CHT® technology:

Bondtech CHT® nozzles split the filament into 3 thinner strands allowing to melt the material from within. In doing so, the material melts faster and higher flow rates can be used.

Core Heating is a patented technology

Registration number: EP3445568A1
Nozzles for 3D printers made of metal with at least one or a multitude of holes to increase the surface area of the heating walls.

Advantages of the Nickel Coating

A Nickel coating is applied to Bondtech Coated Brass nozzles to provide protection against corrosion, erosion, and abrasion. Nickel coated nozzles have more corrosion resistance and lower coefficient of friction, which allows slicker feeding of material and delays plastic adhesion to the nozzle's surface.


Recommended Materials

Use this nozzle with the following materials:

  • PLA
  • ABS
  • HIPS
  • PC
  • TPU
  • TPE
  • Nylon
  • PETG
  • ASA
  • PP
  • PVA

For technical and abrasive materials we recommend to use other nozzles in our range.

Different nozzle sets for different materials

We recommend you to have several sets of nozzles because:
Using different materials with the same nozzles causes deposit build-up inside the nozzle.
These deposits will cause blockages.
We recommend changing nozzles when changing materials.

products.title: Slice Engineering - Plastic Repellent Paint™
products.body_html:
Tired of a nozzle that constantly gets clogged with plastic? Slice Engineering® Plastic Repellent Paint™ offers an expert solution to keep your nozzle free from stubborn plastic buildup.
 
Plastic Repellent Paint™ is an innovative water-based PTFE nanosuspension designed to prevent plastic adhesion on your nozzle and hot block. This advanced coating stops troublesome plastic buildup that leads to print failures. Applied quickly with the brush-top vial, it creates a dry, clear layer that withstands temperatures up to 290°C. Maintain nozzle cleanliness effortlessly using this high-performance solution engineered for reliable printing.
 

Features: 

  • Water-based PTFE nanosuspension
  • Repels plastic from the outside of your nozzle and hot block
  • Applies quickly and uniformly with the vial's brush top
  • Bonds with clean metal surfaces upon first heating to form a dry, transparent coating
  • Endures printing temperatures up to 290°C
  • Each vial contains 3 cc of Plastic Repellent Paint™

The Safety Data Sheet for Plastic Repellent Paint™ can be found on Slice Engineering Documentation page.

Interested in the Plastic Repellent Paint™ White Paper? Click here.

products.title: Polymaker PolyLite™ ABS Filament 1KG 1.75mm
products.body_html:
PolyLite™ is a family of 3D printing filaments made with the best raw materials to deliver exceptional quality and reliability. PolyLite™ covers the most popular 3D printing materials to meet your everyday needs in design and prototyping.

PolyLite™ ABS is made with a specialty bulk-polymerized ABS resin, which has significantly lower volatile content compared to traditional ABS resins. It delivers excellent printing quality with minimal odor during printing.

Note: We only plan carrying Black into the future, if you're interested in other colour, please contact us for special order or see other Polymaker Reseller or our other available ABS from other manufacturers in our store. 


Features:

  • Less Odor / Excellent Quality - PolyLite™ ABS is made with a specialty bulk-polymerized ABS resin, which has significantly lower volatile content compared to traditional ABS resins. It delivers excellent printing quality with minimal odor during printing.
  • Balanced Mechanical / Thermal Properties - PolyLite™ ABS features well balanced mechanical and thermal properties, outperforming regular PLA and PETG in toughness and featuring a heat resistance up to 100°C.
  • Affordable Technology - Polymakers industry leading filament quality and technology now available at an affordable price
  • Uncompromised Quality - With Polymaker's industry leading quality control process and rigorous in-house testing, you can rest assured that PolyLite™ ABS will produce beautiful, reliable and accurate printed parts.

 

Print Settings

 Mechanical Properties (X-Y) Thermal Properties

Nozzle Temperature:
245˚C – 265˚C

Printing Speed:
30mm/s – 50mm/s

Bed Temperature:
90˚C – 100˚C


Bed Surface:
BuildTak®, PEI sheet with ABS slurry


Cooling Fan:
LOW for better surface quality
OFF for better strength


Other:
When printing large
parts with PolyLite™
PETG an enclosure
can be beneficial.

Drying Settings:
70˚C for 6h


Note: Printing
conditions may vary
with different printers
and nozzle diameters

Young’s Modulus:
2174 ± 285 Mpa


Tensile Strength:
33.3 ± 0.8 Mpa


Bending Strength:
72.8 ± 0.7 Mpa


Impact Strength:
12.6 ± 1.1 kJ/m2

Glass Transition
Temperature:
101˚C


Vicat Softening
Temperature:
104˚C

 

Disclaimer: The typical values presented in Polymakers data sheet are intended for
reference and comparison purposes only. Due to the nature of 3D printing they should not be used for design specifications or quality control purposes. Recommend VOC/Air Filtering/fume extraction or print in well ventilated room with fume extraction. 


Storage: It is recommended to store PolyLite™ ABS in the PolyBox™ to prevent moisture absorption which will lower the quality and the mechanical properties of the print. If the filament has absorbed moisture it can be dried at 70°C for 6 hours in a convection oven.

products.title: Bigtreetech SFS V2.0 Smart Filament Sensor Detection Module
products.body_html:
Bigtreetech Smart Filament Sensor V2 

Features: 

  • Rest assured as the SFS V2.0 swiftly identifies nozzle clogs, filament runout, tangled filament, or extruder malfunctions, instantly alerting you on the screen and automatically pausing printing. The side-light indicator will stop blinking upon error detection.
  • Compared to its predecessor, the SFS V2.0 boasts a highly-precise photoelectric sensor, with a theoretical detection length of 2.88MM.
  • With bi-directional feeding and the ingenious pushable filament feeding lever, the SFS V2.0 makes it easier to load various filament types, including flexible materials like TPU.
  • Weighing a mere 36g! SFS V2.0 includes 3 convenient mounting holes at the back, allowing you to easily customize its position with a bracket.

Specification:

  • Voltage: 3.3V-5V
  • Compatible with 1.75mm filament only
  • Firmware: marlin2.0.x / Klipper / RepRap firmware

    Documentation: 

    Manual: https://github.com/bigtreetech/smart-filament-detection-module/blob/master/V2.0/Manual/SFS%20V2.0%20User%20Manual_20231123.pdf

    Ender 3 V2 Guide: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000492388-creality-ender-3-v2-filament-sensor-sfs-

    Voron Mount: https://www.printables.com/search/models?ctx=models&q=sfs+voron

    Please note this is not compatible in touch screen screen mode, only in Marlin display or Octi Print with [HOST_ACTION_COMMANDS , HOST_PROMPT_SUPPORT, ADVANCED_PAUSE_FEATURE ] enabled in Marlin firmware. As Touch screen mode, it won't paused print or it won't allow process to change filament step, unless you connect sensor onto display and start from from display. If you start print via USB, plug the sensor into mainboard. 

    Klipper Example Config: You will need to setup M600 command, see klipper documentation for more information. 

    [filament_motion_sensor sfs]
    detection_length: 20.0
    # The minimum length of filament pulled through the sensor to trigger
    # a state change on the switch_pin
    # Default is 7 mm.
    extruder: extruder
    switch_pin: PG14 # Depend on your pinout
    pause_on_runout: False
    runout_gcode:
    M118 Runout Detected
    M600
    insert_gcode:
    M118 Insert Detected
    #event_delay:
    #pause_delay:

    Install/Review Video:

products.title: Voron Tap Tap Tap Probe Kit - LDO Rails
products.body_html:
The Voron Tap Tap Tap Probe Kit with LDO Rails offers a complete and precise solution for 3D printer bed probing and calibration. Featuring high-quality LDO stainless steel Z1 rails, this kit ensures durability and smooth motion for reliable measurements. Designed for accurate and consistent probe activation, it integrates seamlessly with Voron builds, enhancing print quality by improving first-layer adhesion and leveling. 

 

Note 1: Batch 1 PCB is larger V2 (5-24V) - Please ensure you print the correct parts. [OBP666]

Note 2: Kits does not include printed parts.

Note 3: As usual, only transport oil is apply to rail/carriage. Please clean and apply grease beforehand. Please use this printed parts to load rail from Tap Github. As this tight pre-load, please load carefully.

Note 4: Batch 2 will be higher priced OBP971N51 due to limited OBP666

Note 5: Current LDO kits are not R8 compatible. 

 

WHAT IS TAP?

Tap is a nozzle-based z-probe for the V2 and Trident printer designs. The entire toolhead moves to trigger an optical switch. Tap offers many advantages over other z-probes; 

Extreme Precision 

A well constructed Tap, when in service on a well-constructed printer, will be able to measure your Z position reliably with a precision of 0.4 μm (0.0004 mm). This precision will help you better use and maintain your printer.

Any Build Surface, Change at will

Tap can measure any securely mounted build surface. Print on Glass, Garolite, Alumina, Moon dust...it no longer matters. Textured plates are ideal for Tap, but adhesive PEI sheets may also be used. Tap is unaffected by beds with magnetic fluctuations (note: magnets may affect the build surface Tap is sensing, such as pulling the plate tighter over the magnet). Once Tap is setup, you should not need to re calibrate after changing nozzles or build plates.

Voron Durability, High Temperature Operations

Tap uses light to detect movement and will never wear out. The sensor in Tap is rated to operate at 70C to 100C and will not degrade over time the way a contact switch or inductive probe can.

Hundreds of PIF quality kits were printed using Tap. Some test printers had over 1,000,000 probe cycles to test durability.

No Complicated Macros

For consistent probing temperatures, Tap uses a single ‘activate_gcode’ macro in the [probe] config. Tap is always ready to probe and requires no docking or undocking moves.

Z Endstop Elimination

There is no need for a separate Z endstop. Once the offset is configured, it will hold without appreciable drift. It is normal to need slightly different offsets when switching between filament types.

Crash Protection

With Tap installed, the nozzle and bed are protected from minor crashes (such as accidentally setting your Z to 1 mm below the build surface

 

Documentation: 

More Information: https://github.com/VoronDesign/Voron-Tap

TAP Probe Release Live stream: https://youtu.be/JLUDLJQXZeU

products.title: Bigtreetech EBB SB2209 / EBB2240 CAN V1.0 for Voron StealthBurner
products.body_html:
The EBB SB2209/SB2240 CAN is a nozzle tooling board designed by the 3D printing team of Shenzhen BIQU Technology Co., Ltd. for Voron StealthBurner, which can communicate via USB or CAN port, greatly simplifying wiring. 

What is Included: 

EBB SB2209/2240 includes:

  • EBB SB2240/2209 CAN x1
  • EBB SB0000 CAN x 1
  • 3m CAN bus Cable x 1
  • Heat Sink x 1
  • DIY Crimp Terminal Set x 1
  • Jumper Cap Set x 1
  • Zip Ties x 2
  • Fixing Screw Set x 1
  • Gifts: 30PIN wire x 1
  • 100K NTC B3950 thermistor x 1

EBB SB2209 RP2040 includes:

  • EBB 2209 RP2040 CAN x1
  • EBB SB0000 CAN x 1
  • 3m CAN bus Cable x 1
  • Heat Sink x 1
  • DIY Crimp Terminal Set x 1
  • Jumper Cap Set x 1
  • Zip Ties x 2
  • Fixing Screw Set x 1

What are the differences between SB2209 CAN and SB2240 CAN？

  • The built-in drivers. SB2209 CAN has a built-in TMC2209 driver, while SB2240 has a built-in TMC2240 driver.
  • Driver working mode. The TMC2209 is working with UART mode, and the TMC2240 is the latest TMC ultra-silent driver chip working with SPI mode.
  • The RP2040 offering larger connector size for easier crimping but lacks some feature such as independent voltage selection.

Documentation: 

The installation guidance has been updated, you can go to our support article to have a look.

https://support.dremc.com.au/support/solutions/articles/51000313005-ebb36-ebb42-ebb-sb-2240-2209-documentation

No Canbus? You will need U2C V2.1 connected to your raspberry pi or Pi Can or newer boards running can bridge via your main MCU can bus port: https://store.dremc.com.au/products/bigtreetech-ebb-36-42-can-bus-for-connecting-klipper-expansion-device?variant=42511548612777 or https://store.dremc.com.au/products/pican-usb-to-can-bus-adapter

Wiring with Control Boards (CAN H is Yellow, CAN L is Green Wire)

e.g.

  • Manta M8P + EBB SB2240/2209 CAN + EBB SB0000 CAN
  • Octopus Pro + U2C + Raspberry Pi + EBB SB2240/2209 CAN
